{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presented with severe, crushing, substernal chest pain and ST elevations in leads I and aVL on electrocardiogram, which are indicative of an acute myocardial infarction. The autopsy findings of ischemia in the left atrium and posterior left ventricle suggest that the left circumflex artery, which supplies the lateral and posterior walls of the left ventricle, was most likely affected in this patient.", "answer_choice": "B"}
